Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the significance of the sign by presenting it as an official statement in Australia, when in fact it is a doctored image created by a conservative Facebook page.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the existence of the sign, as the provided photograph has been proven to be fake.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the sign represents the official stance of Australia towards immigrants, which is not supported by any factual information.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider alternative explanations for the creation and circulation of the fake sign, such as political motives or the desire to provoke a reaction.
